intro: Sisymbrium deserticola, commonly known as the desert mustard, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often covered in fine hairs. Sisymbrium deserticola is adapted to harsh environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in dry conditions.
